review: The Fire stick is severely limited by Amazon.  It contains the Miracast technology that allows screen mirroring.  However, they gimped the device, so that I cannot mirror from other Miracast devices, only Kindles.  And, I expect support for all of the major streaming services like Hulu, Google Play, Vudu (Walmart), Redbox and more.  I have a Surface and a Samsung phone.  Both are Miracast capable and neither works with the Fire Stick.  Amazon made a great product and then intentionally ruined it.Okay, if I had unlimited HDMI ports, I might consider keeping this. Not.  I don't want to have a dongle for Google ChromeCast, a dongle for Amazon, an Apple TV for Apple, etc.  I have had Windows 8.1, Mac, iPhone, Samsung/Android and Amazon Kindle products in my home.  All of them support Maracast except Apple of course.  The only products I have gotten rid of were the Fire Stick and Kindle Fire.  I dumped both or the same reason.  Amazon delivered products that were intentionally limited to prevent interoperability.  While I am on the topic, I am moving away from buying movies and TV on Amazon.  The movies I bought before could be downloaded to my PC.  Amazon removed that capability.  Now I can only download the movies to a Kindle.  What a shiest!  I'm sick of Amazon offering cools stuff and then later pulling away interoperability.  They are becoming more and more like Apple in that way.  And, it is pushing me toward other products and services like Android and Windows.  I can access any service on my Windows PC and Windows tablet.  Kindle products were appealing because the were cheap.  They lost all appeal when they put a below standard interface on top of a great product (Android) and took away most of the benefits.
author: Linda J. Advena "busy mom"
